text:
Flushing Meadow Park (Queens): Three of the industrial exhibits at the New York World's Fair 1939-40. View 1 shows the Ford Motor Company Building, on the west side of Grand Central Parkway, and the statue "Samson and the Lion," by the sculptor Benjamin Hawkins.

View 2 shows the Aviation Building (right) and the South Corona gate to the Fair, on the east side of 111th Street and 53rd Avenue. The building suggests a plane with its nose stuck inside a hangar. The architects are William Lescaze and J. G. Carr.

In view 3 is the Railroads Building, viewing north along the east side of 111th Street from 51st Avenue.

View 1: May 29, 1939
Views 2,3: June 23, 1940.

P. L. Sperr

111th Street, at the N.W. corner of 51st Avenue. The parking space is for visitors to the New York World's Fair of 1939-40. Practically every empty lot in this area was converted into a parking space for the duration of the Fair.

P. L. Sperr

June 23, 1940
